Ousting the Speaker of the House only plunges our country into chaos. Next week, the House will move to elect a new Speaker, & hopefully quickly, so we can return to regular order & finish our work.

More in my Weekly Chat. ‚¨á

.@SpeakerMcCarthy can not only be credited for delivering this Republican majority but has also delivered on his commitments to the American people. He had my full support in January, & he has my full support now.

.@HouseGOP can enact real policy changes & spend our dollars more wisely through full year appropriations, & that is just what we should do.

Government shutdowns only punish the American people, our service members & civilian workforce. This CR would avoid that while allowing Congress to finish the job of fully funding the government & provide critical disaster relief to Hawaii.

If you are having thoughts of self-harm, suicide or are facing a mental health crisis, you can receive confidential help at any time from a mental health professional by calling or texting 9-8-8, & veterans can dial 9-8-8, then press 1 to receive veteran-specific care.

Mental wellness & caring for your mental state are just as important as any other illness. This #SuicidePreventionAwarenessMonth is a critical reminder to take mental health seriously & promote a healthy & mindful lifestyle. 

More ‚¨á
cole.house.gov/media/weekly-‚Ä¶

We have tremendous gratitude for our service members & the families of those fallen in the line of duty. We could never understand the grief of losing a child, & this #GoldStarMothersDay, we honor the mothers of our fallen heroes for their selfless sacrifice in supporting them.

Earlier this week, 4 soldiers from #OK04's @OfficialFtSill became local heroes when they brought to safety a woman who was trapped in her overturned car. This is what serving your country truly looks like. Thank you for your service! #FourthDistrictFriday
army.mil/article/269840/fort‚Ä¶

#OnThisDay in 1862, President Lincoln issued his preliminary Emancipation Proclamation declaring freedom for slaves in January 1863. It represented our nation's first step toward equality for all & was indicative of our country's ability to endure, even during terrible crisis.

While Alzheimer‚Äôs & its causes are still unknown, we must continue to try to uncover better treatments, provide better care & find a cure. This #WorldAlzheimersDay, we recognize the need for disease research, & also think of all those living with Alzheimer's. #ENDALZ

Honored to receive the 2023 National Distinguished Advocacy Award from @ACSCAN. Cancer is a tragic & deadly disease that affects every American family in some form, but through biomedical research, we can find the next breakthrough.

More: tinyurl.com/d994tumh

.@POTUS has stifled what remains of American energy production & his administration will certainly be remembered for its destruction of this critical industry in the U.S.

Happy birthday @usairforce! For 76 years, the U.S. Air Force has provided unparalleled air power around the world to protect the freedom of all Americans. Thank you to all of the brave airmen & women who serve our nation.  #AimHigh

#OnThisDay in 1787, our Founding Fathers signed the oldest surviving written Constitution in the world. 236 years later, we celebrate the resiliency of our principles & institutions as we seek to emulate the wisdom & cooperation of our Founders in the present age.
Proud to join @RepNewhouse's resolution. 2nd Amendment rights are Constitutional rights afforded to all Americans, & no state can suspend the Constitution.

This #POWMIARecognitionDay we resolve to never give up on those who are prisoners of war or have gone missing in action. I certainly share that sentiment because of my uncle & namesake, Tom. May we never forget the sacrifices made by those who fight for our country.

Democrats‚Äô radical green energy agenda has been disastrous, & now some states are looking to ban gas-powered vehicles in coming years. Owning an electric vehicle or not should be up to the individual, not bureaucrats in Washington or California.

More ‚¨á 
cole.house.gov/media/press-r‚Ä¶

If @POTUS would end his war on American energy & unleash energy production here at home, the U.S wouldn't be so vulnerable to foreign production & international supply decisions. It's just another example of this administration leading us in the wrong direction.

I'm always thankful for the extended time during the August district work period to interact directly with constituents & hear firsthand about the issues that matter most to them.

Although the attacks on September 11, 2001 were a test to our national security, Americans stood strong together in the wake of tragedy & for good in the face of evil. We will #NeverForget this day & the nearly 3 thousand innocent lives senselessly taken.

As his treatment begins, I am confident Steve will continue to perform his job as Majority Leader with distinction.

Steve is tough‚Äî& overcoming challenge with strength & faith is part of who he is. I know he will bring that same resolve to this cancer fight. Praying for a quick recovery & good health for my friend.

Today, we honor the 13 service members who were tragically & senselessly killed, & remember their families & all whose lives were forever changed.

In addition, billions of dollars of military equipment, trusted allies & American civilians were left behind & the Afghan people were turned over to the same terrorist regime that hosted & sheltered Osama Bin Laden.

#OnThisDay 2 years ago, @POTUS' inept & disastrous withdrawal of U.S. troops from Afghanistan resulted in the deadliest attack on Americans in Afghanistan since 2011 with 13 U.S. service members killed & hundreds of innocent bystanders wounded.

What "Bidenomics" has really brought the U.S. is the worst inflation rate in 40 years, the highest deficit in American history & an economy where the average American's real wages are declining rather than improving.

On this #NationalAgricultureDay, we recognize the farmers, ranchers, foresters & other agriculture workers in Oklahoma & across the nation. They are the fuel of America & we would come to a halt without them. Thank you!

"Forgiving" student debt doesn't mean no one is paying, & this executive order would have been unfair to the millions of Americans who did not go to college or already paid their loans off. I applaud SCOTUS' decision in rejecting this mandate & standing with American taxpayers.

Happy #FathersDay! Today, I am thinking of my father, John, who devoted his life to his family & his country. Fathers have an irreplaceable role in our families & we thank them for the abundance of sacrifices they make.
